segment.source: Tools
segment.target: Tools

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Toolkit in the ADK provides a set of performance-related tests called assessments.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Toolkit in the ADK provides a set of performance-related tests called assessments.

segment.source: The assessment results are used to diagnose potential problems, so that the hardware and software that you develop are both responsive and have a minimal impact on battery life, startup performance, and shutdown time.
segment.target: The assessment results are used to diagnose potential problems, so that the hardware and software that you develop are both responsive and have a minimal impact on battery life, startup performance, and shutdown time.

segment.source: The same assessments are available to OEM/ISV/IHV partners, enthusiasts, and other members of the community, to establish a common framework to measure, compare, and review aspects of quality.
segment.target: The same assessments are available to OEM/ISV/IHV partners, enthusiasts, and other members of the community, to establish a common framework to measure, compare, and review aspects of quality.

segment.source: The Windows Performance Toolkit consists of two independent tools: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) and Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).
segment.target: The Windows Performance Toolkit consists of two independent tools: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) and Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA).

segment.source: WPR is a powerful recording tool that creates Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) recordings.
segment.target: WPR is a powerful recording tool that creates Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) recordings.

segment.source: You can run WPR from the user interface (UI) or from the command line (CL).
segment.target: You can run WPR from the user interface (UI) or from the command line (CL).

segment.source: WPR provides built-in profiles that you can use to select the events you want to record.
segment.target: WPR provides built-in profiles that you can use to select the events you want to record.

segment.source: WPA is a powerful analysis tool that combines a flexible UI with extensive graphing capabilities and data tables that can be pivoted and have full text search capabilities.
segment.target: WPA is a powerful analysis tool that combines a flexible UI with extensive graphing capabilities and data tables that can be pivoted and have full text search capabilities.

segment.source: Fast Startup Behavior
segment.target: Fast Startup Behavior

segment.source: Introduced in Windows 8, Fast Startup is the default boot behavior.
segment.target: Introduced in Windows 8, Fast Startup is the default boot behavior.

segment.source: The shutdown process was updated to include writing data to disk in a way that mirrors how hibernate works.
segment.target: The shutdown process was updated to include writing data to disk in a way that mirrors how hibernate works.

segment.source: During boot, the system goes through the phases that are described in the following table.
segment.target: During boot, the system goes through the phases that are described in the following table.

segment.source: CPU Scheduling and Threads
segment.target: CPU Scheduling and Threads

segment.source: Because the number of processors in a system is limited, all threads cannot be run at the same time.
segment.target: Because the number of processors in a system is limited, all threads cannot be run at the same time.

segment.source: Windows implements processor time-sharing, which allows a thread to run for a period of time before the processor switches to another thread.
segment.target: Windows implements processor time-sharing, which allows a thread to run for a period of time before the processor switches to another thread.

segment.source: The act of switching between threads is called a context-switch and is performed by a Windows component called the dispatcher.
segment.target: The act of switching between threads is called a context-switch and is performed by a Windows component called the dispatcher.

segment.source: Each thread exists in a particular execution state at any given time.
segment.target: Each thread exists in a particular execution state at any given time.

segment.source: Windows uses three states that are relevant to performance: Running, Ready, and Waiting.
segment.target: Windows uses three states that are relevant to performance: Running, Ready, and Waiting.

segment.source: Threads being executed are in the Running state.
segment.target: Threads being executed are in the Running state.

segment.source: Threads that can execute, but are currently not running, are in the Ready state.
segment.target: Threads that can execute, but are currently not running, are in the Ready state.

segment.source: Threads that cannot run (because they are waiting for a particular event) are in the Waiting state.
segment.target: Threads that cannot run (because they are waiting for a particular event) are in the Waiting state.

segment.source: The following figure illustrates the possible thread transitions.
segment.target: The following figure illustrates the possible thread transitions.

segment.source: A thread in the Running state initiates a transition to the Waiting state by calling a wait function such as WaitForSingleObject or Sleep( 0).
segment.target: A thread in the Running state initiates a transition to the Waiting state by calling a wait function such as WaitForSingleObject or Sleep( 0).

segment.source: A running thread or kernel operation readies a thread in the Waiting state (for example, SetEvent or timer expiration).
segment.target: A running thread or kernel operation readies a thread in the Waiting state (for example, SetEvent or timer expiration).

segment.source: A thread in the Ready state is scheduled for processing by the dispatcher when a running thread waits or reaches the end of its quantum of execution.
segment.target: A thread in the Ready state is scheduled for processing by the dispatcher when a running thread waits or reaches the end of its quantum of execution.

segment.source: A thread in the Running state is switched out and placed into the Ready state by the dispatcher when it is preempted by a higher priority thread or when its quantum ends.
segment.target: A thread in the Running state is switched out and placed into the Ready state by the dispatcher when it is preempted by a higher priority thread or when its quantum ends.

segment.source: Thread state becomes an important factor in performance only when a user is waiting for a thread to complete an operation.
segment.target: Thread state becomes an important factor in performance only when a user is waiting for a thread to complete an operation.
